revised_title: Condensation of Gases into Liquids: Sulphurous Acid, Sulphuretted Hydrogen, Carbonic Acid, and Euchlorine
tldr: The author describes the process of condensing various gases into liquids, including sulphurous acid, sulphuretted hydrogen, carbonic acid, and euchlorine, through a series of experiments using different materials and conditions. The properties and behaviors of these liquid compounds are also discussed.
